comment: Chemistry isn't for everyone, but he made me terrified of it! He moves extremely fast, expects you to always be ahead, and his power points don't give you much to take notes from. If you don't understand something he'll probably explain it to you, but very sarcastically. I dropped the course because I (along with most of the class) was failing.

You have to work extremely hard for the grade you want. He gives homework online and it isn't easy! (Also you have to stay caught up) There are no quizzes your grade is just based off homework and test which have some multiple choice and some short answer. His PowerPoint slides were ok but I thought the book helped more. Good luck.....

If you do not want to put in the effort, do not take Dr. Delafuente's class. However, if you are willing to put forth the effort, you will develop a better understanding of chemistry. Downloadprint out his PowerPoints, and go to class! As a person, he's the no-nonsense kind, but he will certainly help you if you need it.
Prof. Delafuente is a great professor as long as you go to class. If you go to class, it is ten times harder to pass

1,000 points broken down into 200 point pieces: 4 tests, drops lowest, comprehensive final, & online hw (DO IT!! It can be a letter grade of difference).  Go to class! Go to SI sessions & practice on your own.   book is good for clarification & hw on your own; buy it from the sapling (hw $38) website for under $100 NOT THE BOOKSTORE! ($200+)
4 tests, one dropped. He does move extremely fast but if you outline the chapters and go to lecture it helps a lot. no electronic allowed.

He has an odd sense of humor. He conveys the information fairly well but moves EXTREMELY fast. If at any point you get lost i would advise going to one of the SI sessions offered. I would recommend anyone take him for chem 1151

Awesome professor, tough class. There's a lot of material to cover so he can go through it quickly which can get confusing. SI sessions helps immensely. Not a tough grader. Very funny guy, makes the lectures interesting and throws in lots of personal stories. You need the book. The homework can get rough at times. Passed, but def had to work for it

Delafuente is a very tough teacher and you have to work for your grade. There are four tests all together and they are very hard but he drops the lowest test grade. He is a good teacher, he just makes you work for your grade big time. There is also no attendance but i wouldnt recommend missing class a lot. Also use the book to study for your tests.

Dr. Delafuente is a great Chem Teacher. He makes sure you understand the subject. You have to study for tests. You need your textbook! He will not go over every part of what you are learning, but if you go to the SI sessions you can ask the SI leader for  help. He is very helpful and is willing to go over the test one on one.

Your success in his class depends on YOUR effort to study.  Very cheesy and sarcastic, nice old man. Explains material well. Easy online hw & drops the lowest test score. He's serious though- he'll push you to succeed and think. He loves what he does and is always there to help you in effort to prepare his students to be the best nurses.
This professor is extremely sarcastic, if you ask a question expect him to joke before answering you. The home work takes a long time, don't wait until the last minute, STUD!

Chemistry is a tough subject, but I feel like this professor went above and beyond to help the students who actually show up to class not only pass his course, but to also understand the material and apply it practically. Coming to class is essential. Reading the book is essential. Great professor.

he really knows his stuff. he's extremely sarcastic. he's willing to help if you put forth the work. YOU NEED A TEXTBOOK. it helps a lot because the powerpoints only glide over the topics. you have four tests and a final, and he drops the lowest grade. you're going to have to work for you grade. STRONGLY suggest attending class.

Mr. Delafuente seems kind of mean at first, but he just has an appreciation for sarcasm. Go to class or don't; his lectures aren't the most helpful. If you can study well on your own, it will be an easy A. He curves his tests by a lot.
Was a very difficult class, need to read the book before lecture to understand what is going on. A very nice professor but very confusing.

I took chemistry 1151, and I found it super easy. He goes right off the powerpoint and posts them to D2L for you to access. He only have 4 tests, so really make sure to study. Show up to class- without his explanation, you'll be lost.

He gives about 4 test the whole year. He presents everything off a power point and he post them on D2L. If you don't go to class, the power points don't make sense because he explains them in class. he is very sarcastic! It also helps a lot to go to the SI sessions because it is practice for what the test questions will look like.
He definitely prepares you for tests by doing a lot of practice problems. Although attendance is not mandatory, it would be very hard to pass if you do not show up.
Not a very fun or interesting professor. He makes you feel stupid if you ask a question he finds easy. Tests are tricky, but he curves the grades.

Professor Delafuente does everything he can to prepare you for classes that you will take in the future, and doesn't sugar-coat the fact that chemistry can be very difficult if you do not put in the time and effort to study. Always helpful when I had questions, and also a good lab professor. I definitely recommend him!

Professor Delafuente is exceedingly helpful. I took this course over the summer, and even with the shortened semester he managed to teach us everything we needed to know. He tells you exactly what to expect, and his tests have a built-in curve. I wish I could take him for 1152!

Course is just above high school AP chemistry difficulty. He is good at teaching to his audience of potential nursing students. Willing to help if you are making an honest effort. Read the text and use the extra web resources. He gives a LOT of extra credit on the tests, but they are difficult and require solid understanding of the material.

Only go to class if you are going to pay attention. Don't ever pull out your phone either! He posts notes online but attendance is important to actually understand the material. Final grade is just homework and 3 test grade. Homework is super easy, tests are easy if you study for at least a few days in advance. There are optional study sessions.

Delafuente is a good professor. Kinda sarcastic but once you know that he's funny. Gives pretty clear instructions. You have homework online which counts as a test grade but as long as you keep up with it it's easy. He also drops your lowest test grade. I would recommend him to anyone taking a beginner chem class.

I really enjoyed his class, even though it was at 8 am. He tells you what to expect and gives you lots of other resources to learn the material.  He is the only professor using Sapling, which was easy for the homework.  Highly recommend this professor! Only complaint was the final which didn't match the other tests.  It was my lowest grade.

Chemistry is a hard subject, of course. Helpful teacher and makes funny jokes. However, each question on a test will have "more than one correct response" or "no correct response" as an option which is just frustrating. Read the book. Always study EVERYTHING, he doesn't stick to his word when he says something wont be on test. Enjoyed the class!

I highly recommend this professor! He has a dry humor & treats students as they should be treated-like adults. Online homework is taken as a test grade at end of semester (and the HW is helpful). Uses PowerPoints but doesn't read off of them. To get an A, come to class. He suggests many resources for extra help. The tests have built-in bonus pts!

Professor Delafuente is an amazing professor. Your grade is definitely not handed to you, as it shouldn't be. That would defeat the purpose of you going to class. His powerpoints are VERY clear & it really helps to print them out & follow along that way instead of writing everything down. He's very sarcastic but its funny & interesting. Take him!

Awesome professor! I highly recommend you take him. I don't know how he got such a low rating, he is very helpful. I struggled in chemistry in high school, but he made it so easy! This class does require some work, but not an overwhelming amount. Take it seriously and use the resources he gives you. My favorite professor so far!

At first, I thought he was rude and arrogant. Turns out, he's now my favorite professor and if you try to get to know him, he's more than helpful. Never used the book, homework helped my grade, and tests reflect what you do in class so missing lecture would be stupid. If you don't try, he won't invest in you. Take him if you're a nursing major!!

Delafuente is a selfish professor. He does not care about his students, and pretty much loathes underclassmen. He does not prepare you for tests, homework does not reflect what is taught in class, tests are extremely difficult, and he does not take kindly to you asking questions. AVOID taking him at all costs! He's not a good professor at all!

He is a great professor. You must be willing to listen and handle what you have to handle but he makes sure that you leave with a clear understanding of the material and that you are ready for the test as long as you do your homework and use chemteam duh

Be prepared to teach yourself everything. I'm not a chemistry person, but it would've helped a lot to have a good teacher. Homework saved my grade. He does not prepare you for the final. Do not take him if you can avoid it.

Not a terrible professor, but be prepared to teach yourself the majority of the material. HW will save your grade. Never even bought the book, you don't need it. Study notes and PP and you'll do fine.

Probably of the coolest professors yet at KSU ! I am glad his class was difficult because it made me feel like I accomplished something great! You can't obtain the chemistry knowledge through osmosis ! And...practice, practice, practice ! Overall,very approachable and don't be on your cellphone or he will definitely call you out during lecture !

I knew going into this class I would have a difficult time, but his teaching made it worse. He has a lot of cheesy jokes and can be very snarky at times. He doesn't like to finish problems he shows during class. I learned more from the book and homework. I do not recommend him unless you already know a lot about chemistry.

For starters, I am definitely not a chemistry person, to be quite honest I come close to despising the subject. But this professor made chemistry fun to me and put it in a manner that was easy to understand and witty. No attending class is not mandatory but I don't see you passing otherwise, there is too much content not to show up. Great teacher.
Hardest chem class you could take. Studied days for tests and still barely passed or failed every time.do not take this class if you don't have to!
Great acher Lots of extra credit on tests! Do the homework and practice problems! Study for your grade!

Did not like him. He wasn't very clear in class. He would only work out half the problem and then continue without fully explaining what he was lecturing. His tests were OK. I found his teching so bad that I dropped the course and retook it next semester and got a B. If your good at Chem you'll do fine, If not you'll have a really hard time.

The material itself can be difficult but Professor Delefuente gives clear instruction and specifies what he expects you to know for the test.  He also gives you more than ample opportunity to get extra credit (he offers 20 pts . on each test) 4 tests(he drops your lowest), homework counts as a test grade, and the final, thats it! I liked him

He's not the best but he's also not the worst. Take him if you have to, but I would recommend you take someone else. He tries to be funny and does nothing but fail. Just read the powerpoints and do practice problems and you'll be fine. I got over 100 on every test.

lectures and power points are basic compared to the questions on the tests. Last two tests are easy and he drops the lowest grade. Definitely do the homework but don't do it last minute, or you will be up all night. Don't recommend him if you're not good in science or if its your first semester. Rarely used the textbook and have to teach yourself

He's an okay teacher and is willing to help. But his lectures and power points are basic compared to what he gives on the test. Last two tests are easy and he drops the lowest grade. Definitely do the homework, it will help save your grade but do it early since its hard sometime. recommend not to take him if you're not naturally good in science

He's an okay teacher. However his tests are harder than the stuff he goes over in class.Make sure to do the homework since that will hold up your grade. His first test is easy, the two tests after that are hard but the last two are easy. You have to teach yourself alot in this class so I dont recommend him if you are not good in science at all.
He is an ok professor. His tests are pretty hard. He tries to help everyone but his lectures don't really help.

He is also very knowledgeable about chemistry. Class is not mandatory but you will not succeed with out going to class and doing hw. I also hear reading the text book helps but i do not touch it. His test aren't easy but if you practice you can do good they are 220 points out of 200 because he understands chem is hard.

I am being very honest here and agree with some other similar remarks.This professor goes by his PowerPoint slides which are very basic as compared to what he gives in the exam,there is a major disconnect there.half of the time he is only talking to the front seaters and not audible to a class of 70.all in all I would never take him for sciences .

Read your Textbook and go to class and do all the HW assignments. I failed my Final, because I didn't study. I was burnt out that semester, because I had a heavy course load. However, I still left with a B, and A for Lab, because I accumulated enough points.

Would not take him again. He is hard to focus on & very soft spoken and he thinks he is funny, but he isnt.Chem is a tough course and if you need step by step explanations DONT take him. If you are good at teaching yourself you may enjoy this, but I did not...tests were way too short for the amount of material covered.

Professor puts powerpoints online and goes over them in class. Gives a bunch of websites for study material. He is very cheesy and hard to focus on. His tests are very inconsistent. A plus though is he throws out a lot of questions and gives lots of extra credit points. Overall just an average teacher.
I love this professor, if you care, he cares.  Chem is hard and fast paced, but if you review when you leave class you will do great.  one of the few professors who actually teaches you!!!
He is a very nice and helpful teacher. However, his tests are very inconsistent and did not come from his notes. Make sure to study from the websites he gives you and to read each chapter.

This Professor was very helpful whenever you needed it, but is this class was far from easy. He gave slides and taught the material well, but the tests were not clear and did not really relate to the material in his slides. He does not give study guides, but instead gives multiple high school websites. The sites were no help when it came to tests.

CHEM 1151 LECTURE: I AM A VERY GOOD STUDENT AND BUSTED MY BUTT AND GOT A "C". HES NOT CONSISTENT WITH HIS TEST. HE HAS DIFFERENT FORMATS FOR HIS TESTS EVERYTIME AND DO NOT CORRELATE HIS NOTES WITH HIS TEST. AWFUL TEACHER
Very helpful professor. Offers a lot of extra credit points. Also, he provides websites that help prepare students for tests. Easy A, if you put in the effort and study.

I never "got" chemistry before this class. Prof. D is a great teacher.  He curves the tests and offers a lot of homework/quizzes so you can bomb one or two and still get a good grade. He tells you EXACTLY where to go to study for the tests online. He takes a lot of tests DIRECTLY from these sites. If you study and are not dumb you will do great.

His tests werent really that bad; however, the quizzes and hw checks he gave out where not helpful at all. They weren't a tool to help you see where you were. Overall, if you can avoid him i'd do it. Doesn't look like he's really trying to help you get a good grade

Very nice guy and tries to be helpful to his students.  Wants his students to succeed.  With that being said..he teaches like a highschool teacher, gives alot of pop quizzes. Likes to use high school websites for review...takes test questions from online question bank..will work with you.  Notes are very unclear and tests can be confusing..

I had Prof. Delafuente for lab and he was so nice! Lab was hard for me, but he broke down the procedure at the beginning of lab and if you still didn't understand something you could easily ask for help. My lab partner and I would talk to him for 10-15 minutes sometimes in class because he's so approachable. Wish I could have him for 1152!

Terrible!!! I dont care what anybody says this guy is horrible! He does help you if you need but his notes are not even his so he has to read them with us during class and has a hard time explaining them b/c he didnt write them! Plus he always talks about going to all these high school websites and crap, HELLO, we are in COLLEGE NOW DUDE!

A nice professor.  He wants his students to do well but sometimes doesn't always explain concepts thoroughly.  Not hard to do well with some effort though.  I found him to be very approachable with questions.  Had him for lab and lecture and did well.

This class is terrible! I disliked chem before I started now I hate it even more! He doesn't explain things and gets frustrated when you ask. His tests are complicated and hard to understand. Half the stuff he says doesn't make sense. And he always brags about teaching for so long.
had him for 1151 lab. He was a great lab teacher. Very knowledgable but not uptight or full of himeself. Attend the labs and follow directions and you will do fine.

DON'T LISTEN TO THIS CRAZY PERSON THAT POSTED BAD STUFF ABOUT HIM.  HE'S GREAT, VERY HELPFUL, AND UNDERSTANDING.  YOU JUST HAVE TO GO TALK TO HIM. CHEM 1212 IS EXTREMELY HARD TO COMPREHEND. ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IT GO TO CLASS, DO HOMEWORK, AND STUDY.

He is definately a scientists. He'll go off into left field and explain something that we don't need to know which only leds to more confusion. He gets aggrevated when he has to re-explain something over again. Intimidating and not very helpful when asking for extra help. Does give great links and worksheets. Test can be tricky.

Nice professor- I am not great at chemistry but he breaks things down to a level that is more understandable. He also posts practice sheets and gives good websites to help you. 4 tests and you get to drop the lowest. Same with quizes.Helpful powerpoints you can print and use to add notes.He usuallly gives advance notice of quizes. Almost no hw.
